page.title: 01LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: The area around{Burtonwood village has been, and still is, very much a{farming}area. An old school log book of the late{1800's}often refers to the large number of absentees during hay making. South of the village is the old site of{Burtonwood American Air Base}which was reputed to be the largest in Europe and saw much activity during the Second World War.An American Base remains, as a storage depot for{Euro- {pean U.S. Army}equipment. Part of the old aerodrome is now the property of Warrington{New Town Development. { }The{Psychiatric Hospital}at{Winwick played a vital part during the{World {Wars}as a{military hospital.}So great were the numbers of wounded that a special branch line was built from the main railway line to transport {soldiers}into hospital.
